beginnings.title: 01 / BEGINNINGS
heading: I didn't become a software engineer to write code.
I became one to build worlds.
content: I started young, driven by curiosity — not just about how things work, but why people use them.
I wasn't content building tools; I wanted to build experiences — the kind that make life easier, smoother, more meaningful.
What captured me was the idea that with a few keystrokes, you could shape something real — something useful, beautiful, alive.

process.title: 02 / PROCESS
process.heading: I built one layer at a time — until I could build it all.
content: From early prototypes to production-ready systems, I've walked the full stack and back.
I've worn every hat: designer, architect, frontend craftsman, backend strategist. I've turned napkin sketches into full-blown platforms.

Eventually, I built Coffi — my proudest creation, where I led every step from concept to scale, crafting not just an app, but a vision for the future of digital work, a platform born from scratch and grown with purpose.

competition.title: 03 / COMPETITION
heading: I learned how to build fast, under fire —
and with grace.
content: Representing Colombia in WorldSkills, I became national champion, then climbed the international ranks. There, I honed not just skill — but clarity, pressure-resilience, and performance under extreme stakes.
Those intense months taught me how to perform under pressure, how to learn fast, and how to build with both precision and beauty.

design.title: 04 / DESIGN
heading: I don't separate design from code —
I see them as conversation.
content: Design and code are not separate disciplines. They're voices in the same conversation.
I code like a designer, and design like an engineer. I believe in systems that feel good to use, because intuition should be engineered too.

lifestyle.title: 05 / LIFESTYLE
lifestyle.heading: I move freely — and so does what I build.
content: I live and work lightly. Remote by default. Grounded by curiosity.
Nomadic by choice, I collect places, ideas, and inspirations and pour them into the things I build.
Because great software, like great living, should be adaptive, intentional, and free.

future.title: 06 / FUTURE
future.heading: Still learning. Still building. Always chasing better.
content: An engineer. A designer. A founder in spirit. Rooted in creativity, trained through pressure, and always in motion — toward whatever's next.
